history.text: This movie seems to have a really good rating.
I really liked the movie because it was interesting and thrilling and very unique.
The movie is scary, but I think I would like it
I didn't know it was based on a novel. I think it would be an interesting read if it was anything like the movie.
What do you think about them choosing a great white shark to be Jaws?
It gives Great Whites a bad rep
Even the reviews are mixed
I would probably rather watch the movie than read the novel though
I don't feel that way about all movies, but I think I would about this one.
I wonder if it is a lot like the movie, or if they've changed a lot of things.
I would think that they had to cut a lot of extra scenes/dialogue to make the film.
I think there is a lot of stuff you can get from the movie though that you can't get from the book. Like the tension, and how scary some parts are even when the shark isnt seen.
That's true. And the characters might appeal to you more.

By the way, do you think it's weird that it's the police chief that is hunting the shark? I mean I know there is a marine biologist, and a professional shark hunter, but I wonder why the police chief is helping.
To keep death rates low I guess. I'm not sure who would help in that situation anyway.
The first girl that dies in the movie, the one that was skinny dipping, how can anyone believe she died from a boating accident.
Well the judge ruled it, so maybe he kept the witnesses quiet.
It seems like he cared more about the towns reputation than keeping people safe. Which if there are a bunch of people dying in your town, wouldn't that run the reputation too?
Also, would an oceanographer really know how to tell / be able to confirm that someone died from a shark attack?
I agree.
The oceanographer might know what a sharks bite looks like, based on jaw and teeth dental records
True, if he's familiar enough with a great white he could make an educated guess. They knew it wasn't a tiger shark just based on the tooth they found.
Quint, the professional shark hunter, is my favorite character.
I wonder why Vaughn was devastated, if people keep telling you these attacks are from something else, why would you be surprised when another attack happens? He is my least favorite character.

I agree. He may have been in denial since he was hoping it wouldn't effect the town's summer economy. Especially since they had a lot of tourists on the Fourth of July. Maybe he thought it was an isolated incident.
Especially having people pulling pranks. He may have thought it wasn't that big of a deal.
Having a chance that there is a large predator out there and having many people come to the beach at once was a disaster waiting to happen.
I agree. He doesn't seem like a very good mayor.
Oh noooo Quint died
Yeah, that part bummed me out. He was such a good character.
He was. But his work was worth it since they managed to kill the real culprit.
I think it's weird though that the police chief was one of the characters to live, even though he wasn't a professional shark hunter or oceanographer or anything like that.
He got to live because he probably stayed away from the water. Maybe even though he pretended like the claims were wrong, he knew it deep inside.
True. When Hooper got into the water in a cage Jaws nearly killed him.
Hooper was really brave, I wouldn't have gone in the water even with a cage.
I wouldn't have either.
I think the scene where Brody is laying down a chum like and the shark just appears behind the boat is a really good and iconic scene.
Brody also did some quick thinking, using the scuba tank.
